column1: One day the Emperor went hunting
column2: and before setting out he said to his son-in-law
column3: "Do you remain in the castle during my absence. I give to you nine keys which you must keep carefully by you. I give you free leave to open three or four rooms. You will find in them silver and gold in abundance; there is also no lack of weapons
column4: or of any kind of treasure. You may even
column6: open eight of the rooms. But beware of unlocking the ninth. Leave that one alone; for
column7: he added, if you do not it will be the worse for you." Upon this the Emperor departed
column8: leaving his son-in-law at home alone. Hardly was the Emperor gone when the Prince began to open one door after another
column9: until he had examined eight rooms in succession. His eyes beheld in them treasures of all kinds. When at last he came to the door of the ninth room he said to himself
column10: "I have seen and done so many wonderful things
column11: and shall it be forbidden me to enter a certain room?" So he unlocked the door and went in. What a sight!
